answers.answer: Thanks for that link, R Glass.I did find information related to autoimmune hepatitis...  But since my FibroScan found a "healthy liver", I'm pretty sure that isn't my issue.  :(I estimate my HCV infection at about 1991 or 2 and I was diagnosed with type 1 diabetes in early 1993 (my 20s).

question: I saw an immunologist today who has diagnosed me with yet another autoimmune disease.  Dermographic urticaria.  It started almost two years ago with swollen, intensely itchy lymph nodes on the back of my head.  That lasted for 34 days.  On the same day that the lymph nodes calmed down, the rashes started.  They were terrible.I took a short course of prednisone early 2010 and that stopped the rashes completely.  After stopping the prednisone, the rashes returned but not to the same degree.My HCV diagnosis was incidental to all this stuff going on, I was just tested for everything to try to figure out what was wrong with me.  My diagnosis came about a year ago.Is anyone aware of any studies that have proven a link between HCV and autoimmune disorders?  Anything I've found uses words like "controversial" or "yet to be proven".
title: Yay, ME!  Another autoimmune disease... Sheesh.
